Subject: AW: Automatische Antwort: Automatische Antwort: AW: AW: AW: [EXT] RE: AW: [EXT] RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #417657 - - AW: [EXT] Ping Castle: Wr [ ]




Dear Elizaveta,



thanks for the inputs. Do you have additional Details for “runas”? Is it intended for ADJoined, only? Trusted ADs? How about non-trusted (UNC Path hardening)?




For accessing trusts:

Connecting from a PC, which is ADJOINED to AD1 and accesses trusted AD2, using our AD1 account: We noticed a difference when accessing GPOs between PingCastle and Windows Native.


While accessing via [Windows + R]  \AD2-FQDNSYSVOLAD2-FQDNPolicies from Windows (PC, ADJOINED to AD1), we can access it:





While PingCastle seems to be failing accessing the same remote location and files after the ADWS listing around https://github.com/netwrix/pingcastle/blob/master/ADWS/WindowsFileConnection.cs#L56:

 Network access denied





We currently assume this might be related to imported DLLs:


https://github.com/netwrix/pingcastle/blob/master/ADWS/WindowsFileConnection.cs#L103
https://github.com/netwrix/pingcastle/blob/master/ADWS/WindowsFileConnection.cs#L106




Any clue about that? Where do these DLLs come from?







Fabian Schrödter
Consultant Corporate & Aviation Services, FRA E/NHVS

Lufthansa Industry Solutions AS GmbH
Am Messeplatz 1, 65479 Raundheim, Germany

M: +49 151 58922709
E: fabian.schroedter@lhind.dlh.de
C: Termin buchen

TextBody:
Hi Fabian,

Thank you for your patience.

If “runas” is not working (the workstation must belong to the domain or a trusted domain) PingCastle has no chance to work.
We also discourage to use “—user” as GPO are prohibited due to the SYSVOL hardening that requires integrity (which is causing problem with impersonation that PingCastle is using)

Another solution is to shift – right click to display a context menu to run the program under another identity.

Let me know if this helps.

Regards,
Ali Asif
Technical Support Engineer
1-949-407-5125 x1
____________________ _______
Cybersecurity That Works for You

6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com

We need to use “runas” to avoid that GPO issue.

TextBody: ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000EDUkz:ref Dear Ali, thanks for the feedback and the advice. Unfortunately, it does not match what we intend to do. We involved Microsoft Windows Server product team for evaluating GPO access across non-domain joined scenarios for proceeding with our intention. It might be the case that centralized scanning of ADs is not possible due to UNC path hardening. I’ll be on leave till next year and want to thank you for your support, which is highly appreciated. As of now, I don’t know where the strategy for AD is moving us to, but I’ll keep Netwrix and Le Toux positively in my mind. I wish you calm holidays and a good shift to 2025! Fabian Schrödter Consultant Corporate & Aviation Services, FRA E/NHVS Lufthansa Industry Solutions AS GmbH Am Messeplatz 1, 65479 Raundheim, Germany M: +49 151 58922709 E: fabian.schroedter@lhind.dlh.de C: Termin buchen LHIND.de BE GREEN: keep it on the screen & switch off before you go​​​.​​ Von: Netwrix Support Datum: Donnerstag, 21. November 2024 um 13:23 An: SCHROEDTER, FABIAN Betreff: [EXT] RE: 00417657 - Ping Castle: Wrong User/Pass for GPO, only Hello Fabian, I’m reaching out to see if the instructions I sent in my last email helped resolve the issue you were experiencing. I haven’t heard back from you, so I wanted to check if everything is working smoothly now or if you still need further assistance. If you’re all set, just let me know, and I can close the ticket. If you still need help or have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out—I’m here to support you. Looking forward to your response! Ticket Number: 00417657 Ticket Subject: Ping Castle: Wrong User/Pass for GPO, only Ticket Details: Dear Ping Castle Team, I tested the community edition for Ping Castle 3.2.0.1 and noticed following error in trace.log. Login works successfully using username@example.com and Password. Image Ping Castle is started via following script (so you know the parameters): Image I noticed GPO access denied in v2.9.2.0 when passing creds with user argument · Issue #80 · netwrix/pingcastle · GitHub, where an equal issue occured. Any idea, why this error happens? Thank you!
